INGREDIENTS REQUIRED - 
• Mutton piece - 750 grams 
• Basmati rice - 2 cups 
• Oil - 4 tablespoons 
• Pure ghee - 3 teaspoons 
• Dalchinis/Cinnamon sticks - 2 
• Moti elaichis/Black cardamoms - 6 
• Laungs/Cloves - 4 
• Onions (finely chopped) - 2 
• Dahi/Curd - ½ cup 
• Yellow chilly powder - 1 teaspoon 
• Salt - as required 
• Ginger (finely chopped) - 2 tablespoons 
• Mace powder/Javitris - a pinch 
• Mint leaves/Pudinas (finely chopped) - 2 tablespoons 
• Kesar/Saffron (prepare: soaked and crushed in a little milk) - a pinch


METHOD 
1. Boil rice in plenty of water until just tender but not fully cooked. 
2. Drain and keep aside. 
3. Heat oil in a heavy bottomed pan. Add dalchini, moti elaichi and laung. 
4. Saute onions until light brown. Add the mutton and saute until golden brown. 
5. Add salt, yellow chilly powder and dahi. Add 3 cups of water and simmer until the mutton is almost cooked. 
6. Remove the cooked mutton from the gravy and spread in an oven proof dish. 
7. Sprinkle half the cream, mint, ginger and mace powder over the meat. 
8. Place half of the rice over the mutton. 
9. Sprinkle the strained mutton Curries and Gravies, rest of the cream, melted ghee and saffron over the rice. 
10. Place rest of the rice on top. 
11. Cover the dish with a tight fitting lid and seal the sides with atta (dough) 12. Place in a hot oven for 15-20 minutes. Remove the atta and serve piping hot. 12. Place in a hot oven for 15-20 minutes. Remove the atta and serve piping hot.
